t: Since*pn my youth they have often attacked me — let*ln Israel say —
since*ln my youth they have often attacked me, but*ln they have not prevailed against me.
Plowmen*ln plowed over my back; they*ln made their furrows long.
The*ln Lord*s is righteous; he*ln has cut the ropes of the wicked.
Let*pn all who hate Zion be*ln driven back in disgrace.
Let*ln them be like grass on the rooftops, which*ln withers before it grows up
and*ln can’t even fill the hands of the reaper or*ln the arms of the one who binds sheaves.
Then*ln none who pass by will say, “May*ln the Lord’s*s blessing be on you. We*ln bless you in the name of the Lord.”*s
